column4: Does the alternate-installer run dd if=/dev/urandom of=/dev/sda* when it encrypts your harddrive?

selected encrypted root and lvm I mean.
about six hours on my laptop
by forever, that means a long time
Debian takes about 3 hours to do that step so they are definitely doing some randomisation.
6 hours is a long time, so ...
you young people have such short attention spans! ;)
with the alternate installer is there an option to choose "expert vga=771" like in debian?
I downloaded gutsy last weekend from Thailand. The md5sums matched but It had corrupt files. Must of been the cd I burned.

how don't i have that ability? furthermore, how do you even come to saying that
